llAbs.description:
Returns an integer that is the positive version of val.

integer llAbs( integer val )

llAcos.description:
Returns a float that is the arccosine in radians of val

float llAcos( float val )

llAddToLandBanList.description:
Add avatar to the land ban list for hours, or indefinitely if hours is zero.

llAddToLandBanList( key avatar, float hours )

llAddToLandPassList.description:
Add avatar to the land pass list for hours, or indefinitely if hours is zero.

llAddToLandPassList( key avatar, float hours )

llAdjustSoundVolume.description:
Adjusts volume of attached sound.

llAdjustSoundVolume( float volume )

llAgentInExperience.description:
Determines whether or not the specified agent is in the script's experience.Returns a boolean (an integer) that is TRUE if the agent is in the experience and the experience can run in the current region.

integer llAgentInExperience( key agent )

llAllowInventoryDrop.description:
Allows for all users without modify permissions to add inventory items to a prim.

llAllowInventoryDrop( integer add )

llAngleBetween.description:
Returns a float that is the angle in radians between rotation a and rotation b.

float llAngleBetween( rotation a, rotation b )

llApplyImpulse.description:
Applies impulse to object

llApplyImpulse( vector momentum, integer local )

llApplyRotationalImpulse.description:
Applies rotational impulse to object.

llApplyRotationalImpulse( vector force, integer local )

llAsin.description:
Returns a float that is the arcsine in radians of val

float llAsin( float val )

llAtan2.description:
Returns a float that is the arctangent2 of y, x.

float llAtan2( float y, float x )

llAttachToAvatar.description:
Attaches the object to the avatar who has granted permission to the script. The object is taken into the users inventory and attached to attach_point.

llAttachToAvatar( integer attach_point )

llAttachToAvatarTemp.description:
Follows the same convention as llAttachToAvatar, with the exception that the object will not create new inventory for the user, and will disappear on detach or disconnect. Also, this function can be used on avis other than the owner (if granted permission) in which case the ownership is changed to the new wearer.

llAttachToAvatarTemp( integer attach_point )

llAvatarOnLinkSitTarget.description:
Returns a key that is the UUID of the user seated on the prim.

key llAvatarOnLinkSitTarget( integer link )

llAvatarOnSitTarget.description:
Returns a key that is the UUID of the user seated on the prim.

key llAvatarOnSitTarget(  )

llAxes2Rot.description:
Returns a rotation that is defined by the 3 coordinate axes

rotation llAxes2Rot( vector fwd, vector left, vector up )

llAxisAngle2Rot.description:
Returns a rotation that is a generated angle about axis

rotation llAxisAngle2Rot( vector axis, float angle )

llBase64ToInteger.description:
Returns an integer that is str Base64 decoded as a big endian integer.

integer llBase64ToInteger( string str )

llBase64ToString.description:
Returns a string that is the Base64 str decoded into a conventional string.

string llBase64ToString( string str )

llBreakAllLinks.description:
Dellinks all prims in the link set.

llBreakAllLinks(  )

llBreakLink.description:
Delinks the prim with the given link number in a linked object set

llBreakLink( integer link )

llCastRay.description:
Cast a ray from start to end and report collision data for intersections with objectsReturns a list of strided values with an additional integer status_code on the end. Each stride consists of two mandatory values {key uuid, vector position} and possibly some optional values {integer link_number, vector normal} see RC_DATA_FLAGS for details. The status_code if it is negative is an error code, otherwise it is the number of hits (and strides) returned.

list llCastRay( vector start, vector end, list options )

llCeil.description:
Returns an integer that is the integer value of val rounded towards positive infinity (return >= val).

integer llCeil( float val )

llClearCameraParams.description:
Resets all camera parameters to default values and turns off scripted camera control.

llClearCameraParams(  )

llClearLinkMedia.description:
Clears (deletes) the media and all params from the given face on the linked prim(s).Returns a status (an integer) that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation.

integer llClearLinkMedia( integer link, integer face )

llClearPrimMedia.description:
Clears (deletes) the media and all params from the given face.Returns a status (an integer) that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation.

integer llClearPrimMedia( integer face )

llCloseRemoteDataChannel.description:
Closes XML-RPC channel.

llCloseRemoteDataChannel( key channel )

llCollisionFilter.description:
Sets the collision filter, exclusively or inclusively.

llCollisionFilter( string name, key id, integer accept )

llCollisionSound.description:
Suppress default collision sounds, replace default impact sounds with impact_sound at the volume impact_volume

llCollisionSound( string impact_sound, float impact_volume )

llCollisionSprite.description:
Suppress default collision sprites, replace default impact sprite with impact_sprite

llCollisionSprite( string impact_sprite )

llCos.description:
Returns a float that is the cosine of theta.

float llCos( float theta )

llCreateCharacter.description:
Creates a pathfinding entity, known as a "character", from the object containing the script.  Required to activate use of pathfinding functions.

llCreateCharacter( list options )

llCreateKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to create a key-value pair associated with the script's Experience using the given key (k) and value (v).Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed.

key llCreateKeyValue( string k, string v )

llCreateLink.description:
Attempt to link the script's object with target.

llCreateLink( key target, integer parent )

llCSV2List.description:
This function takes a string of values separated by commas, and turns it into a list.Returns a list made by parsing src, a string of comma separated values.

list llCSV2List( string src )

llDataSizeKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to request the used and total amount of data allocated for the Experience.Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed and the results.

key llDataSizeKeyValue(  )

llDeleteCharacter.description:
Convert the object back to a standard object, removing all pathfinding properties.

llDeleteCharacter(  )

llDeleteKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to delete a key-value pair associated with the script's Experience with the given key (k).Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed and the results.

key llDeleteKeyValue( string k )

llDeleteSubList.description:
Returns a list that is a copy of src but with the slice from start to end removed.

list llDeleteSubList( list src, integer start, integer end )

llDeleteSubString.description:
Returns a string that is the result of removing characters from src from start to end.

string llDeleteSubString( string src, integer start, integer end )

llDetectedGrab.description:
Returns a vector that is the grab offset of the user touching the object; only works in the touch event.

vector llDetectedGrab( integer number )

llDetectedGroup.description:
Returns an integer that is TRUE if the detected object or agent has the same active group as the prim containing the script. Otherwise FALSE is returned.

integer llDetectedGroup( integer number )

llDetectedKey.description:
Returns a key that is the UUID of the detected object or avatar number.

key llDetectedKey( integer number )

llDetectedLinkNumber.description:
Returns the link_number (an integer) of the triggered event. If not supported by the event, returns zero.

integer llDetectedLinkNumber( integer number )

llDetectedName.description:
Returns a string that is the name of the detected item.

string llDetectedName( integer item )

llDetectedOwner.description:
Returns the key (UUID) of the owner of the object.

key llDetectedOwner( integer number )

llDetectedPos.description:
Returns a vector that is the position (in region coordinates) of detected object number.

vector llDetectedPos( integer number )

llDetectedRot.description:
Returns the rotation of detected object number.

rotation llDetectedRot( integer number )

llDetectedTouchBinormal.description:
Returns a vector that is the surface binormal (tangent to the surface, pointing along the positive T (V) direction of tangent space) where the touch event was triggered.  Along with llDetectedTouchNormal, this information can be used to find the tangent space at the touch location.

vector llDetectedTouchBinormal( integer index )

llDetectedTouchFace.description:
Returns an integer that is the index of the face the avatar clicked on.

integer llDetectedTouchFace( integer index )

llDetectedTouchNormal.description:
Returns a vector that is the surface normal (perpendicular to the surface) where the touch event was triggered.  Along with llDetectedTouchBinormal, this information can be used to find the tangent space at the touch location.

vector llDetectedTouchNormal( integer index )

llDetectedTouchPos.description:
Returns the vector position where the object was touched in region coordinates, unless it is attached to the HUD, in which case it returns the position in screen space coordinates.

vector llDetectedTouchPos( integer index )

llDetectedTouchST.description:
Returns a vector that is the surface coordinates for where the prim was touched. The x & y vector positions contain the horizontal (s) & vertical (t) face coordinates respectively (<s, t, 0.0>). Each component is usually in the interval [0.0, 1.0] with the origin in the bottom left corner.[1] With some mesh objects, values of less than 0.0 and higher than 1.0 have been observed.

vector llDetectedTouchST( integer index )

llDetectedTouchUV.description:
Returns a vector that is the texture coordinates for where the prim was touched. The x & y vector positions contain the horizontal (u) & vertical (v) texture coordinates respectively (<u, v, 0.0>). Like llDetectedTouchST, the interval of each component will be [0.0, 1.0] unless the texture repeats are set to a non-default value. Increasing or decreasing the texture repeats of the face will change this interval accordingly. Additionally,  unlike with llDetectedTouchST, changing a texture's rotation will change the results of this function.

vector llDetectedTouchUV( integer index )

llDetectedType.description:
Returns an integer mask that is the types of detected object or avatar.

integer llDetectedType( integer number )

llDetectedVel.description:
Returns the vector velocity of detected object or avatar number.

vector llDetectedVel( integer number )

llDialog.description:
Shows a dialog box in the lower right corner of the avatar's screen (upper right in Viewer 1.x) with a message and choice buttons, as well as an ignore button. This has many uses ranging from simple message delivery to complex menu systems.

llDialog( key avatar, string message, list buttons, integer channel )

llDie.description:
Deletes the object. The object does not go to the owners Inventory:Trash.

llDie(  )

llDumpList2String.description:
Returns a string that is the list src converted to a string with separator between the entries.

string llDumpList2String( list src, string separator )

llEdgeOfWorld.description:
Checks to see whether the border hit by dir from pos is the edge of the world (has no neighboring simulator).Returns a boolean (an integer) value. FALSE indicating there is a simulator in the direction indicated.

integer llEdgeOfWorld( vector pos, vector dir )

llEjectFromLand.description:
Ejects avatar from the parcel.

llEjectFromLand( key avatar )

llEmail.description:
Sends an email to address with subject and message.

llEmail( string address, string subject, string message )

llEscapeURL.description:
Returns a string that is the escaped/encoded version of url, replacing spaces with "%20" etc. The function will escape any character not in [a-zA-Z0-9] to "%xx" where "xx" is the hexadecimal value of the character in UTF-8 byte form.

string llEscapeURL( string url )

llEuler2Rot.description:
Returns a rotation representation of the Euler Angles v.

rotation llEuler2Rot( vector v )

llEvade.description:
Characters will (roughly) try to hide from their pursuers if there is a good hiding spot along their fleeing path. Hiding means no direct line of sight from the head of the character (center of the top of its physics bounding box) to the head of its pursuer and no direct path between the two on the navmesh.

llEvade( key target, list options )

llExecCharacterCmd.description:
Send a command to the pathing system.

llExecCharacterCmd( integer command, list options )

llFabs.description:
Returns a float that is the positive version of val.

float llFabs( float val )

llFleeFrom.description:
Directs a character to keep a specific distance from a specific position in the region or adjacent regions.

llFleeFrom( vector position, float distance, list options )

llFloor.description:
Returns an integer that is the integer value of val rounded towards negative infinity (return <= val).

integer llFloor( float val )

llForceMouselook.description:
Sets if a sitting avatar should be forced into mouselook when they sit on this prim.

llForceMouselook( integer mouselook )

llFrand.description:
Returns a float that is pseudo random in the range [0.0, mag) or (mag, 0.0].[1] This means that the returned value can be any value in the range 0.0 to mag including 0.0, but not including the value of mag itself. The sign of mag matches the return.

float llFrand( float mag )

llGenerateKey.description:
Generates a key using Version 5 (SHA-1 hash) UUID generation to create a unique key.Returns the key generated.

key llGenerateKey(  )

llGetAccel.description:
Returns a vector that is the acceleration of the object in the region frame of reference.

vector llGetAccel(  )

llGetAgentInfo.description:
Returns a bit field (an integer) containing the agent information about id.

integer llGetAgentInfo( key id )

llGetAgentLanguage.description:
Returns a string that is the language code of the preferred interface language of the user avatar.

string llGetAgentLanguage( key avatar )

llGetAgentList.description:
Requests a list of agents currently in the region, limited by the scope parameter.Returns a list [key id0, key id1, ..., key idn] or [string error_msg] -  returns avatar keys for all agents in the region limited to the area(s) specified by scope

list llGetAgentList( integer scope, list options )

llGetAgentSize.description:
Returns a vector that is an estimated size of the requested avatar.

vector llGetAgentSize( key avatar )

llGetAlpha.description:
Returns a float that is the alpha of face.

float llGetAlpha( integer face )

llGetAndResetTime.description:
Returns a float that is script time in seconds and then resets the script time to zero.

float llGetAndResetTime(  )

llGetAnimation.description:
Returns a string that is the name of the currently playing locomotion animation for avatar id. See the table below.

string llGetAnimation( key id )

llGetAnimationList.description:
Returns a list of keys of playing animations for avatar.

list llGetAnimationList( key avatar )

llGetAnimationOverride.description:
Returns a string that is the name of the animation that is being used for the specified animation state (anim_state).

string llGetAnimationOverride( string anim_state )

llGetAttached.description:
Returns the attach_point (an integer) the object is attached to or zero if it is either not attached or is pending detachment.

integer llGetAttached(  )

llGetAttachedList.description:
Returns a list of public attachments worn by an avatar.

list llGetAttachedList( key avatar )

llGetBoundingBox.description:
Returns a list that is the bounding box of object relative to its root prim, in local coordinates.Format: [ (vector) min_corner, (vector) max_corner ]

list llGetBoundingBox( key object )

llGetCameraPos.description:
Returns a vector that is the current camera position for the agent the task has permissions for.

vector llGetCameraPos(  )

llGetCameraRot.description:
Returns a rotation that is the current camera orientation for the agent the task has permissions for.

rotation llGetCameraRot(  )

llGetCenterOfMass.description:
Returns the vector position of the object's center of mass in region coordinates.

vector llGetCenterOfMass(  )

llGetClosestNavPoint.description:
Used to get a point on the navmesh that is the closest point to point.Returns a list containing a single vector which is the closest point on the navmesh to the point provided or an empty list.

list llGetClosestNavPoint( vector point, list options )

llGetColor.description:
Returns a vector that is the color on face.

vector llGetColor( integer face )

llGetCreator.description:
Returns a key for the creator of the prim.

key llGetCreator(  )

llGetDate.description:
Returns a string that is the current date in the UTC time zone in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".

string llGetDate(  )

llGetDisplayName.description:
Returns a string that is the non-unique display name of the avatar specified by id.

string llGetDisplayName( key id )

llGetEnergy.description:
Returns a float that is how much energy is in the object as a percentage of maximum

float llGetEnergy(  )

llGetEnv.description:
Returns a string with the requested data about the region.

string llGetEnv( string name )

llGetExperienceDetails.description:
Returns a list of details about the experience. This list has 6 components: [string experience_name, key owner_id, key experience_id, integer state, string state_message, key group_id]

list llGetExperienceDetails( key experience_id )

llGetExperienceErrorMessage.description:
Returns a text description of a particular Experience LSL error constant.Returns a string describing the error code passed or the string corresponding to error. Returns XP_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ERROR if the error is not a valid error code.

string llGetExperienceErrorMessage( integer error )

llGetForce.description:
Returns a vector that is the force (if the script is physical)

vector llGetForce(  )

llGetFreeMemory.description:
Returns the integer of the number of free bytes of memory the script can use.

integer llGetFreeMemory(  )

llGetFreeURLs.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of available URLs.

integer llGetFreeURLs(  )

llGetGeometricCenter.description:
Returns the vector that is the geometric center of the object relative to the root prim.

vector llGetGeometricCenter(  )

llGetGMTclock.description:
Returns a float that is the time in seconds since midnight GMT.  Value appears to be truncated to the second.

float llGetGMTclock(  )

llGetHTTPHeader.description:
Returns a string that is the value for header for request_id.

string llGetHTTPHeader( key request_id, string header )

llGetInventoryCreator.description:
Returns a key of the creator of the inventory item.

key llGetInventoryCreator( string item )

llGetInventoryKey.description:
Returns a key that is the UUID of the inventory name

key llGetInventoryKey( string name )

llGetInventoryName.description:
Returns a string that is the name of the inventory item number of type. Returns an empty string if no item of the specified type is found in the prim's inventory (or there are less than or equal to number items of the type).

string llGetInventoryName( integer type, integer number )

llGetInventoryNumber.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of items of a given type in the prims inventory.

integer llGetInventoryNumber( integer type )

llGetInventoryPermMask.description:
Returns a bit field (an integer) of the requested permission category for the inventory item

integer llGetInventoryPermMask( string item, integer category )

llGetInventoryType.description:
Returns an integer that is the type of the inventory item name

integer llGetInventoryType( string name )

llGetKey.description:
Returns the key of the prim the script is in.

key llGetKey(  )

llGetLandOwnerAt.description:
Returns a key that is the land owner at pos.

key llGetLandOwnerAt( vector pos )

llGetLinkKey.description:
Returns the key of the linked prim link

key llGetLinkKey( integer link )

llGetLinkMedia.description:
Get the media params for a particular face on a linked prim, given the desired list of named params.Returns a parameter list (a list) of values in the order requested.

list llGetLinkMedia( integer link, integer face, list params )

llGetLinkName.description:
Returns a string that is the name of link in link set

string llGetLinkName( integer link )

llGetLinkNumber.description:
Returns an integer that is the link number of the prim containing the script.

integer llGetLinkNumber(  )

llGetLinkNumberOfSides.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of faces (or sides) of the prim link.

integer llGetLinkNumberOfSides( integer link )

llGetLinkPrimitiveParams.description:
These functions are very similar; the difference is the latter takes a link parameter, and does not cause the script to sleep.

list llGetLinkPrimitiveParams( list params )

llGetListEntryType.description:
Returns the type (an integer) of the entry at index in src.

integer llGetListEntryType( list src, integer index )

llGetListLength.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of elements in the list src.

integer llGetListLength( list src )

llGetLocalPos.description:
Returns a vector that is the position relative (local) to the root.

vector llGetLocalPos(  )

llGetLocalRot.description:
Returns the rotation of the prim relative to the root.

rotation llGetLocalRot(  )

llGetMass.description:
Returns a float that is the mass of object (in Lindograms) that script is attached to.

float llGetMass(  )

llGetMassMKS.description:
Returns a float that is the mass (in Kilograms) of object that script is attached to. Functionally identical to llGetMass except for the unit used in the return value.

float llGetMassMKS(  )

llGetMaxScaleFactor.description:
Returns a float that is the largest scaling factor that can be used with llScaleByFactor to resize the object.  This maximum is determined by the Linkability Rules and prim scale limits.

float llGetMaxScaleFactor(  )

llGetMemoryLimit.description:
Get the maximum memory a script can use.Returns the integer amount of memory the script can use in bytes.

integer llGetMemoryLimit(  )

llGetMinScaleFactor.description:
Returns a float that is the smallest scaling factor that can be used with llScaleByFactor to resize the object.  This minimum is determined by the prim scale limits.

float llGetMinScaleFactor(  )

llGetNextEmail.description:
Get the next queued email that comes from address, with specified subject.

llGetNextEmail( string address, string subject )

llGetNotecardLine.description:
Requests the line line of the notecard name from the dataserver.Returns the handle (a key) for a dataserver event response.

key llGetNotecardLine( string name, integer line )

llGetNumberOfNotecardLines.description:
Requests the number of lines in notecard name via the dataserver event (cast dataserver value to integer)Returns the handle (a key) for a dataserver event response.

key llGetNumberOfNotecardLines( string name )

llGetNumberOfPrims.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of prims in a link set the script is attached to.

integer llGetNumberOfPrims(  )

llGetNumberOfSides.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of faces (or sides) of the prim.

integer llGetNumberOfSides(  )

llGetObjectDesc.description:
Returns a string containing the description of the prim the script is attached to.

string llGetObjectDesc(  )

llGetObjectDetails.description:
Returns a list of the details for id, specifically those requested in params.

list llGetObjectDetails( key id, list params )

llGetObjectMass.description:
Returns a float that is the mass of id

float llGetObjectMass( key id )

llGetObjectName.description:
Returns a string that is the name of the prim the script is attached to.

string llGetObjectName(  )

llGetObjectPermMask.description:
Returns a bit field (an integer) of the requested permission category for the object containing this script.

integer llGetObjectPermMask( integer category )

llGetObjectPrimCount.description:
Returns an integer that is the total number of prims in the object that contains prim.

integer llGetObjectPrimCount( key prim )

llGetOmega.description:
Returns a vector that is the rotation velocity of the object in radians per second.

vector llGetOmega(  )

llGetOwner.description:
Returns a key that is the object owner's UUID.

key llGetOwner(  )

llGetOwnerKey.description:
Returns a key that is the owner of prim id

key llGetOwnerKey( key id )

llGetParcelDetails.description:
Returns a list that is the parcel details specified in params (in the same order) for the parcel at pos.

list llGetParcelDetails( vector pos, list params )

llGetParcelFlags.description:
Returns a bit field (an integer) of parcel flags (PARCEL_FLAG_*) for the parcel that includes the point pos.

integer llGetParcelFlags( vector pos )

llGetParcelMaxPrims.description:
Returns an integer that is the maximum combined land impact allowed for objects on the parcel at pos.

integer llGetParcelMaxPrims( vector pos, integer sim_wide )

llGetParcelMusicURL.description:
Returns a string containing the parcel streaming audio URL.

string llGetParcelMusicURL(  )

llGetParcelPrimCount.description:
Returns an integer that is the total land impact of objects on the parcel at pos of the given category

integer llGetParcelPrimCount( vector pos, integer category, integer sim_wide )

llGetParcelPrimOwners.description:
Returns a list of all residents who own objects on the parcel at pos and with individual land impact used. The list is formatted as [ key agentKey1, integer agentImpact1, key agentKey2, integer agentImpact2, ... ], and sorted by agent key with a maximum of 100 strides.

list llGetParcelPrimOwners( vector pos )

llGetPermissions.description:
Returns an integer bitfield with the script permissions granted

integer llGetPermissions(  )

llGetPermissionsKey.description:
Returns the avatar (a key) of the avatar that last granted or declined permissions to the script.

key llGetPermissionsKey(  )

llGetPhysicsMaterial.description:
Used to get the physical characteristics of an object.Returns a list in the form [ float gravity_multiplier, float restitution, float friction, float density ]

list llGetPhysicsMaterial(  )

llGetPos.description:
Returns the vector position of the task in region coordinates

vector llGetPos(  )

llGetPrimitiveParams.description:
Returns attribute values (a list) for the attributes requested in the params list.

list llGetPrimitiveParams( list params )

llGetPrimMediaParams.description:
Get the media params for a particular face on an object, given the desired list of names.Returns a parameter list (a list) of values in the order requested.

list llGetPrimMediaParams( integer face, list params )

llGetRegionAgentCount.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of avatars in the region.

integer llGetRegionAgentCount(  )

llGetRegionCorner.description:
Returns a vector in meters that is the global location of the south-west corner of the region the object is in. The z component is 0.0

vector llGetRegionCorner(  )

llGetRegionFlags.description:
Returns an integer that is the region flags (REGION_FLAG_*) for the region the object is in.

integer llGetRegionFlags(  )

llGetRegionFPS.description:
Returns a float that is the mean region frames per second.

float llGetRegionFPS(  )

llGetRegionName.description:
Returns a string that is the current region name

string llGetRegionName(  )

llGetRegionTimeDilation.description:
Returns a float that is the current time dilation, the value range is [0.0, 1.0], 0.0 (full dilation) and 1.0 (no dilation).[1]

float llGetRegionTimeDilation(  )

llGetRootPosition.description:
Returns a vector that is the region position of the root object of the object script is attached to

vector llGetRootPosition(  )

llGetRootRotation.description:
Returns a rotation that is the region rotation of the root prim of the object.

rotation llGetRootRotation(  )

llGetRot.description:
Returns a rotation that is the prim's rotation relative to the region's axes.

rotation llGetRot(  )

llGetScale.description:
Returns a vector that is the scale of the prim.

vector llGetScale(  )

llGetScriptName.description:
Returns a string that is the name of the script that called this function.

string llGetScriptName(  )

llGetScriptState.description:
Returns a boolean (an integer) that is TRUE if the script is running.

integer llGetScriptState( string script )

llGetSimStats.description:
Returns a float that is the requested statistic.

float llGetSimStats( integer stat_type )

llGetSimulatorHostname.description:
Returns a string that is the hostname of the machine the script is running on (same as string in viewer Help dialog)

string llGetSimulatorHostname(  )

llGetSPMaxMemory.description:
Returns the integer of the most bytes used while LlScriptProfiler was last active.

integer llGetSPMaxMemory(  )

llGetStartParameter.description:
Returns an integer that is the script start/rez parameter.

integer llGetStartParameter(  )

llGetStaticPath.description:
Returns a list of position vectors indicating pathfinding waypoints between positions at start and end, for a character of a given radius. The waypoints this function returns are for the 'static' nav mesh, meaning that objects set to "movable obstacle" or "movable phantom" are ignored.

list llGetStaticPath( vector start, vector end, float radius, list params )

llGetStatus.description:
Returns a boolean (an integer) equal to the status of the object.

integer llGetStatus( integer status )

llGetSubString.description:
Returns a string that is the substring of src from start to end, leaving the original string intact.

string llGetSubString( string src, integer start, integer end )

llGetSunDirection.description:
Returns a vector that is a normalized vector of the direction of the sun in the region.

vector llGetSunDirection(  )

llGetTexture.description:
Returns a string that is the texture on face

string llGetTexture( integer face )

llGetTextureOffset.description:
Returns a vector that is the texture offset of face in the x ("U", horizontal) and y ("V", vertical) components. The z component is unused.

vector llGetTextureOffset( integer face )

llGetTextureRot.description:
Returns a float that is the texture rotation, expressed as an angle, on face

float llGetTextureRot( integer face )

llGetTextureScale.description:
Returns a vector that is the texture scale on face (only the x and y components are used).

vector llGetTextureScale( integer face )

llGetTime.description:
Returns a float that is script time in seconds with subsecond precision since the script started, was last reset, or call to either llResetTime or llGetAndResetTime.

float llGetTime(  )

llGetTimeOfDay.description:
Returns a float that is the time in seconds with subsecond precision since Second Life midnight or region up-time (time since when the region was brought online/rebooted); whichever is smaller. If the region is configured so the sun stays in a constant position, then the returned value is the region up-time.

float llGetTimeOfDay(  )

llGetTimestamp.description:
Returns a string that is the current date and time in the UTC time zone in the format "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ff..fZ"

string llGetTimestamp(  )

llGetTorque.description:
Returns a vector that is the torque (if the script is physical)

vector llGetTorque(  )

llGetUnixTime.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of seconds elapsed since 00:00 hours, Jan 1, 1970 UTC from the system clock.

integer llGetUnixTime(  )

llGetUsedMemory.description:
Returns the integer of the number of bytes of memory currently in use by the script.

integer llGetUsedMemory(  )

llGetUsername.description:
Returns a string that is the unique username of the avatar specified by id.

string llGetUsername( key id )

llGetVel.description:
Returns a vector that is the velocity of the object.

vector llGetVel(  )

llGetWallclock.description:
Returns a float that is the time in seconds since midnight Pacific time (PST/PDT), truncated to whole seconds. That is the same as the time of day in SLT expressed as seconds.

float llGetWallclock(  )

llGiveInventory.description:
Give inventory to destination.

llGiveInventory( key destination, string inventory )

llGiveInventoryList.description:
Gives inventory items to target, creating a new folder to put them in.

llGiveInventoryList( key target, string folder, list inventory )

llGiveMoney.description:
Transfer amount of L$ money from script owner to destination avatar.Returns an integer that is always zero. In contrast llTransferLindenDollars returns a key that can be used to match the function call to the resulting transaction_result event and the transaction history.

integer llGiveMoney( key destination, integer amount )

llGodLikeRezObject.description:
Requires God Mode;Rez directly off of UUID if owner has god-bit set.

llGodLikeRezObject( key inventory, vector pos )

llGround.description:
Returns a float that is the ground height directly below the prim position + offset

float llGround( vector offset )

llGroundContour.description:
Returns a vector that is the ground contour direction below the prim position + offset. The contour is the direction of a contour line at that point, that is the direction in which there is no change in elevation.

vector llGroundContour( vector offset )

llGroundNormal.description:
Returns a vector that is the ground normal from the current position + offset.

vector llGroundNormal( vector offset )

llGroundRepel.description:
Critically damps to height if within height * 0.5 of ground or water level (which ever is higher)

llGroundRepel( float height, integer water, float tau )

llGroundSlope.description:
Returns a vector that is the ground slope below the object position + offset

vector llGroundSlope( vector offset )

llHTTPRequest.description:
Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with the body of the request and parameters.Returns a handle (a key) identifying the HTTP request made.

key llHTTPRequest( string url, list parameters, string body )

llHTTPResponse.description:
Responds to request_id with status and body.

llHTTPResponse( key request_id, integer status, string body )

llInsertString.description:
Returns the string dst with src inserted starting at pos.

string llInsertString( string dst, integer pos, string src )

llInstantMessage.description:
Sends an Instant Message specified in the string message to the user specified by user.

llInstantMessage( key user, string message )

llIntegerToBase64.description:
Returns a string that is a Base64 big endian encode of number

string llIntegerToBase64( integer number )

llJson2List.description:
This function takes a string representing JSON, and returns a list of the top level.Returns a list made by parsing src, a string representing json.

list llJson2List( string src )

llJsonGetValue.description:
Gets the value indicated by specifiers from the json string.Returns a string made by parsing json, a string representing json and traversing as specified by specifiers.

string llJsonGetValue( string json, list specifiers )

llJsonSetValue.description:
Returns, if successful, a new JSON text string which is json with the value indicated by the specifiers list set to value.

string llJsonSetValue( string json, list specifiers, string value )

llJsonValueType.description:
Gets the JSON type for the value in json at the location specifiers.Returns the string specifying the type of the value at specifiers in json.

string llJsonValueType( string json, list specifiers )

llKey2Name.description:
Returns a string that is the legacy name of the prim or avatar specified by id.

string llKey2Name( key id )

llKeyCountKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to request the number of keys with the script's Experience.Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed and the results.

key llKeyCountKeyValue(  )

llKeysKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to request a number of keys from the script's Experience.Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed.

key llKeysKeyValue( integer first, integer count )

llLinkParticleSystem.description:
A particle system defined by a list of rules is set for the prim(s) link.

llLinkParticleSystem( integer link, list rules )

llLinkSitTarget.description:
Set the sit location for the linked prim(s). The sit location is relative to the prim's position and rotation.

llLinkSitTarget( integer link, vector offset, rotation rot )

llList2CSV.description:
Returns a string of comma separated values taken in order from src.

string llList2CSV( list src )

llList2Float.description:
Returns a float that is at index in src.

float llList2Float( list src, integer index )

llList2Integer.description:
Returns an integer that is at index in src.

integer llList2Integer( list src, integer index )

llList2Json.description:
This function takes a list and returns a JSON string of that list as either a json object or json array.Returns a string that is either values serialized as a JSON type, or if an error was encountered JSON_INVALID.

string llList2Json( string type, list values )

llList2Key.description:
Returns a key that is at index in src.

key llList2Key( list src, integer index )

llList2List.description:
Returns a list that is a slice of src from start to end.

list llList2List( list src, integer start, integer end )

llList2ListStrided.description:
Returns a list of all the entries in the strided list whose index is a multiple of stride in the range start to end.

list llList2ListStrided( list src, integer start, integer end, integer stride )

llList2Rot.description:
Returns a rotation that is at index in src.

rotation llList2Rot( list src, integer index )

llList2String.description:
Returns a string that is at index in src.

string llList2String( list src, integer index )

llList2Vector.description:
Returns a vector that is at index in src.

vector llList2Vector( list src, integer index )

llListen.description:
Sets a handle for msg on channel from name and id.Returns a handle (an integer) that can be used to deactivate or remove the listen.

integer llListen( integer channel, string name, key id, string msg )

llListenControl.description:
Makes listen event callback handle active or inactive

llListenControl( integer handle, integer active )

llListenRemove.description:
Removes listen event callback handle

llListenRemove( integer handle )

llListFindList.description:
Returns the integer index of the first instance of test in src.

integer llListFindList( list src, list test )

llListInsertList.description:
Returns a list that contains all the elements from dest but with the elements from src inserted at position start.

list llListInsertList( list dest, list src, integer start )

llListRandomize.description:
Returns a list which is a randomized permutation of src.

list llListRandomize( list src, integer stride )

llListReplaceList.description:
Returns a list that is a copy of dest with start through end removed and src inserted at start.

list llListReplaceList( list dest, list src, integer start, integer end )

llListSort.description:
Returns a list that is src sorted by stride.

list llListSort( list src, integer stride, integer ascending )

llListStatistics.description:
Returns a float that is the result of performing statistical aggregate function operation on src.

float llListStatistics( integer operation, list src )

llLoadURL.description:
Shows dialog to avatar offering to load web page at url with message.If user clicks yes, launches the page in their web browser, starting the browser if required.

llLoadURL( key avatar, string message, string url )

llLog.description:
Returns a float that is the natural logarithm of val.If val <= 0 return 0.0 instead.

float llLog( float val )

llLog10.description:
Returns a float that is the base 10 logarithm of val.If val <= 0 return zero instead.

float llLog10( float val )

llLookAt.description:
Cause object to point its up axis (positive z) towards target, while keeping its forward axis (positive x) below the horizon.

llLookAt( vector target, float strength, float damping )

llLoopSound.description:
Plays attached sound looping indefinitely at volume

llLoopSound( string sound, float volume )

llLoopSoundMaster.description:
Plays attached sound looping at volume, declares it a sync master.

llLoopSoundMaster( string sound, float volume )

llLoopSoundSlave.description:
Plays attached sound looping at volume, synced to most audible sync master declared by llLoopSoundMaster.

llLoopSoundSlave( string sound, float volume )

llManageEstateAccess.description:
Use to add or remove agents from the estate's agent access or ban lists or groups from the estate's group access list.Returns a boolean (an integer) TRUE if the call was successful; FALSE if throttled, invalid action, invalid or null id or object owner is not allowed to manage the estate.

integer llManageEstateAccess( integer action, key avatar )

llMapDestination.description:
Opens world map centered on simname with pos highlighted.Only works for scripts attached to avatar, or during touch events.

llMapDestination( string simname, vector pos, vector look_at )

llMD5String.description:
Returns a string of 32 hex characters that is the MD5 checksum of src with a salt of ":"+nonce.

string llMD5String( string src, integer nonce )

llMessageLinked.description:
The purpose of this function is to allow scripts in the same object to communicate. It triggers a link_message event with the same parameters num, str, and id in all scripts in the prim(s) described by link.

llMessageLinked( integer link, integer num, string str, key id )

llMinEventDelay.description:
Set the minimum time between events being handled.

llMinEventDelay( float delay )

llModifyLand.description:
Modify land with action on brush

llModifyLand( integer action, integer brush )

llModPow.description:
Returns an integer that is a raised to the b power, mod c. ( (a**b)%c )

integer llModPow( integer a, integer b, integer c )

llMoveToTarget.description:
Critically damp to target in tau seconds (if the script is physical)

llMoveToTarget( vector target, float tau )

llNavigateTo.description:
Directs an object to travel to a defined position in the region or adjacent regions.

llNavigateTo( vector pos, list options )

llOffsetTexture.description:
Sets the texture u & v offsets for the chosen face.

llOffsetTexture( float u, float v, integer face )

llOpenRemoteDataChannel.description:
Creates a channel to listen for XML-RPC calls. Will trigger a remote_data event with channel id once it is available.

llOpenRemoteDataChannel(  )

llOverMyLand.description:
Returns an integer boolean, TRUE if id is over land owned by the script owner, FALSE otherwise.

integer llOverMyLand( key id )

llOwnerSay.description:
Says msg to the object's owner only, if the owner is currently in the same region.

llOwnerSay( string msg )

llParcelMediaCommandList.description:
Controls the playback of movies and other multimedia resources on a parcel or for an agent.

llParcelMediaCommandList( list commandList )

llParcelMediaQuery.description:
Returns a list containing results of query. The results are in the same order as the request.

list llParcelMediaQuery( list query )

llParseString2List.description:
Returns a list that is src broken into a list of strings, discarding separators, keeping spacers, discards any null (empty string) values generated.

list llParseString2List( string src, list separators, list spacers )

llParseStringKeepNulls.description:
Returns a list that is src broken into a list, discarding separators, keeping spacers, keeping any null values generated.

list llParseStringKeepNulls( string src, list separators, list spacers )

llParticleSystem.description:
Defines a particle system for the containing prim based on a list of rules.

llParticleSystem( list rules )

llPassCollisions.description:
Sets the pass-collisions prim attribute.

llPassCollisions( integer pass )

llPassTouches.description:
Sets the pass-touches prim attribute.

llPassTouches( integer pass )

llPatrolPoints.description:
Sets the object patrolling between the points specified in patrolPoints.

llPatrolPoints( list patrolPoints, list options )

llPlaySound.description:
Plays attached sound once at volume

llPlaySound( string sound, float volume )

llPlaySoundSlave.description:
Plays attached sound once at volume, synced to next loop of most audible sync master declared by llLoopSoundMaster.

llPlaySoundSlave( string sound, float volume )

llPow.description:
Returns a float that is base raised to the power exponent (baseexponent)

float llPow( float base, float exponent )

llPreloadSound.description:
Preloads sound on viewers within range

llPreloadSound( string sound )

llPursue.description:
Causes the object to pursue target.

llPursue( key target, list options )

llPushObject.description:
Applies impulse and ang_impulse to object target

llPushObject( key target, vector impulse, vector ang_impulse, integer local )

llReadKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to read the value associated with the specified key (k) and the script's Experience.Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed and the results.

key llReadKeyValue( string k )

llRegionSay.description:
Says the string msg on channel number channel that can be heard anywhere in the region by a script listening on channel.

llRegionSay( integer channel, string msg )

llRegionSayTo.description:
Says the text supplied in string msg on channel supplied in integer channel to the object or avatar specified by target

llRegionSayTo( key target, integer channel, string msg )

llReleaseControls.description:
Stop taking inputs (that were taken with llTakeControls), dequeues any remaining control events. If PERMISSION_TAKE_CONTROLS was previously granted, it will be revoked.

llReleaseControls(  )

llReleaseURL.description:
Releases the specified URL, it will no longer be usable.

llReleaseURL( string url )

llRemoteDataReply.description:
Send an XML-RPC reply on channel to message_id with payload of string sdata and integer idata

llRemoteDataReply( key channel, key message_id, string sdata, integer idata )

llRemoteLoadScriptPin.description:
Copy script name into target and set to running with a start_param only if target's pin matches pin

llRemoteLoadScriptPin( key target, string name, integer pin, integer running, integer start_param )

llRemoveFromLandBanList.description:
Remove avatar from the land ban list

llRemoveFromLandBanList( key avatar )

llRemoveFromLandPassList.description:
Remove avatar from the land pass list.

llRemoveFromLandPassList( key avatar )

llRemoveInventory.description:
Remove the named inventory item

llRemoveInventory( string item )

llRemoveVehicleFlags.description:
Disable the specified vehicle flags

llRemoveVehicleFlags( integer flags )

llRequestAgentData.description:
Requests data about agent id. When data is available the dataserver event will be raisedReturns the handle (a key) for the dataserver event when it is raised.

key llRequestAgentData( key id, integer data )

llRequestDisplayName.description:
Requests the Display Name of the agent identified by id. When the Display Name is available the dataserver event will be raised. The agent identified by id does not need to be in the same region or online at the time of the request.Returns the handle (a key) that is used to identify the dataserver event when it is raised.

key llRequestDisplayName( key id )

llRequestExperiencePermissions.description:
Asks the agent for permission to participate in the script's Experience.

llRequestExperiencePermissions( key agent, string name )

llRequestInventoryData.description:
Requests data about the item name in the prim's inventory. When data is available the dataserver event will be raised.Returns the handle (a key) that is used to identify the dataserver event when it is raised.

key llRequestInventoryData( string name )

llRequestPermissions.description:
Ask agent for permissions to run certain classes of functions.

llRequestPermissions( key agent, integer permissions )

llRequestSecureURL.description:
Requests one HTTPS:// (SSL) url for use by this object. The http_request event is tiggered with result of the request. HTTPS-in uses port 12043.Returns a handle (a key) used for identifying the result of the request in the http_request event.

key llRequestSecureURL(  )

llRequestSimulatorData.description:
Requests data about region. When data is available the dataserver event will be raised.Returns a handle (a key) for a dataserver event response.

key llRequestSimulatorData( string region, integer data )

llRequestURL.description:
Requests one HTTP:// url for use by this script. The http_request event is triggered with the result of the request. HTTP-in uses port 12046.Returns a handle (a key) used for identifying the result of the request in the http_request event.

key llRequestURL(  )

llRequestUsername.description:
Requests the Username of the agent identified by id. When the Username is available the dataserver event will be raised. The agent identified by id does not need to be in the same region or online at the time of the request.Returns a handle (a key) that is used to identify the dataserver event when it is raised.

key llRequestUsername( key id )

llResetAnimationOverride.description:
If id is not the UUID of an avatar, the dataserver event is not raised.

llResetAnimationOverride( string anim_state )

llResetLandBanList.description:
Resets the animation override of the specified animation state (anim_state) to the corresponding default value.

llResetLandBanList(  )

llResetLandPassList.description:
Removes all residents from the land ban list.

llResetLandPassList(  )

llResetOtherScript.description:
Removes all residents from the land access/pass list.

llResetOtherScript( string name )

llReturnObjectsByID.description:
Resets the script-time timer to zero.

integer llReturnObjectsByID( list objects )

llReturnObjectsByOwner.description:
If the script is owned by an agent, PERMISSION_RETURN_OBJECTS may be granted by the owner.  If the script is owned by a group, this permission may be granted by an agent belonging to the group's "Owners" role.Returns an integer that is the number of objects successfully returned to their owners or an ERR_* flag.

integer llReturnObjectsByOwner( key owner, integer scope )

llRezAtRoot.description:
If the script is owned by an agent, PERMISSION_RETURN_OBJECTS may be granted by the owner.  If the script is owned by a group, this permission may be granted by an agent belonging to the group's "Owners" role.Returns an integer that is the number of objects successfully returned to their owners or an ERR_* flag.

llRezAtRoot( string inventory, vector position, vector velocity, rotation rot, integer param )

llRezObject.description:
Instantiate inventory object rotated to rot with its root at position, moving at velocity, using param as the start parameter

llRezObject( string inventory, vector pos, vector vel, rotation rot, integer param )

llRot2Angle.description:
Instantiate inventory object at pos with velocity vel and rotation rot with start parameter param

float llRot2Angle( rotation rot )

llRot2Axis.description:
Returns a float that is the rotation angle represented by rot

vector llRot2Axis( rotation rot )

llRot2Euler.description:
Returns a vector the rotation axis represented by rot

vector llRot2Euler( rotation quat )

llRot2Fwd.description:
Returns a vector that is the Euler representation (roll, pitch, yaw) of quat, with each component expressed in radians.

vector llRot2Fwd( rotation q )

llRot2Left.description:
Computes the orientation of the local x-axis relative to the parent (i.e. the root prim or the world).Returns a vector that is the forward vector defined by q, i.e. a unit vector pointing in the local positive X direction.

vector llRot2Left( rotation q )

llRot2Up.description:
Computes the orientation of the local y-axis relative to the parent (i.e. relative to the root prim or the world).Returns a vector that is the left vector defined by q, i.e. a unit vector pointing in the local positive Y direction

vector llRot2Up( rotation q )

llRotateTexture.description:
Computes the orientation of the local z-axis relative to the parent (i.e. the root prim or the world).Returns a vector that is the up vector defined by q, i.e. a unit vector pointing in the positive Z direction

llRotateTexture( float angle, integer face )

llRotBetween.description:
Returns a rotation that is the shortest rotation between the direction start and the direction end

rotation llRotBetween( vector start, vector end )

llRotLookAt.description:
Causes an object to smoothly rotate to target_direction with strength resistance at damping force.

llRotLookAt( rotation target_direction, float strength, float damping )

llRotTarget.description:
This function is to have the script know when it has reached a rotation.It registers a rot with a error that triggers at_rot_target and not_at_rot_target events continuously until unregistered.Returns a handle (an integer) to unregister the target with llRotTargetRemove

integer llRotTarget( rotation rot, float error )

llRotTargetRemove.description:
Removes rotational target handle registered with llRotTarget

llRotTargetRemove( integer handle )

llRound.description:
Returns the integer that val is closest to.

integer llRound( float val )

llSameGroup.description:
Returns a boolean (an integer) that is TRUE if uuid and the prim the script is in are of the same group, otherwise FALSE.

integer llSameGroup( key uuid )

llSay.description:
Says the text supplied in string msg on channel supplied in integer channel.

llSay( integer channel, string msg )

llScaleByFactor.description:
Attempts to resize the entire object by scaling_factor, maintaining the size-position ratios of the prims.

integer llScaleByFactor( float scaling_factor )

llScaleTexture.description:
Sets the texture u & v scales for the chosen face.

llScaleTexture( float u, float v, integer face )

llScriptDanger.description:
Returns a boolean (an integer) that is TRUE if pos is over public land, sandbox land, land that doesn't allow everyone to edit and build, or land that doesn't allow outside scripts.

integer llScriptDanger( vector pos )

llScriptProfiler.description:
Enables or disables the scripts profiling state.

llScriptProfiler( integer flags )

llSendRemoteData.description:
Send an XML-RPC request to dest through channel with payload of channel (in a string), integer idata and string sdata.Returns a key that is the message_id for the resulting remote_data events.

key llSendRemoteData( key channel, string dest, integer idata, string sdata )

llSensor.description:
Performs a single scan for name and id with type within radius meters and arc radians of forward vector

llSensor( string name, key id, integer type, float radius, float arc )

llSensorRemove.description:
Removes the sensor setup by llSensorRepeat.

llSensorRemove(  )

llSensorRepeat.description:
Performs a single scan for name and id with type within range meters and arc radians of forward vector and repeats every rate seconds. It does not perform the first scan until rate seconds have passed.

llSensorRepeat( string name, key id, integer type, float range, float arc, float rate )

llSetAlpha.description:
Sets the alpha on face

llSetAlpha( float alpha, integer face )

llSetAngularVelocity.description:
Applies rotational velocity to object.It does the same job as llApplyRotationalImpulse but doesn't depend of the mass of object .

llSetAngularVelocity( vector initial_omega, integer local )

llSetAnimationOverride.description:
Set the animation (anim) that will play for the given animation state (anim_state).

llSetAnimationOverride( string anim_state, string anim )

llSetBuoyancy.description:
Sets the buoyancy of the task or object. Requires physics to be enabled.

llSetBuoyancy( float buoyancy )

llSetCameraAtOffset.description:
Sets the point the camera is looking at to offset for avatars that sit on the object.

llSetCameraAtOffset( vector offset )

llSetCameraEyeOffset.description:
Sets the camera eye offset for avatars that sit on the object.

llSetCameraEyeOffset( vector offset )

llSetCameraParams.description:
Sets multiple camera parameters at once.

llSetCameraParams( list rules )

llSetClickAction.description:
Sets the action performed when a prim is clicked upon (aka click action).

llSetClickAction( integer action )

llSetColor.description:
Sets the color on face of the prim.

llSetColor( vector color, integer face )

llSetContentType.description:
Sets the Internet media type "Content-Type" header of any subsequent LSL HTTP server response via llHTTPResponse.

llSetContentType( key request_id, integer content_type )

llSetDamage.description:
Sets the amount of damage that will be done when this object hits an avatar.

llSetDamage( float damage )

llSetForce.description:
Applies force to the object (if the script is physical)

llSetForce( vector force, integer local )

llSetForceAndTorque.description:
Sets the force and torque of object (if the script is physical)

llSetForceAndTorque( vector force, vector torque, integer local )

llSetHoverHeight.description:
Critically damps to a height above the ground (or water) in tau seconds.

llSetHoverHeight( float height, integer water, float tau )

llSetInventoryPermMask.description:
Requires God Mode.Sets the given permission category to the new value on the inventory item.

llSetInventoryPermMask( string item, integer category, integer value )

llSetKeyframedMotion.description:
Specify a list of times, positions, and orientations to be followed by an object. The object will be smoothly moved between keyframes by the simulator. Collisions with other nonphysical or keyframed objects will be ignored (no script events will fire and collision processing will not occur). Collisions with physical objects will be computed and reported, but the keyframed object will be unaffected by those collisions. (The physical object will be affected, however.)

llSetKeyframedMotion( list keyframes, list options )

llSetLinkAlpha.description:
If a prim exists in the link set at link, set alpha on face of that prim.

llSetLinkAlpha( integer link, float alpha, integer face )

llSetLinkCamera.description:
Sets the camera eye offset, and the offset that camera is looking at, for avatars that sit on the linked prim.

llSetLinkCamera( integer link, vector eye, vector at )

llSetLinkColor.description:
If a prim exists in the link set at link, set color on face of that prim.

llSetLinkColor( integer link, vector color, integer face )

llSetLinkMedia.description:
Set the media params for a particular face on the linked prim(s) without a delay.Returns a status (an integer) that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s).

integer llSetLinkMedia( integer link, integer face, list params )

llSetLinkPrimitiveParams.description:
Sets the prims parameters according to rules.

llSetLinkPrimitiveParams( integer link, list rules )

llSetLinkPrimitiveParamsFast.description:
Sets the prims parameters according to rules.

llSetLinkPrimitiveParamsFast( integer link, list rules )

llSetLinkTexture.description:
If a prim exists in the link set at link, set texture on face of that prim.

llSetLinkTexture( integer link, string texture, integer face )

llSetLinkTextureAnim.description:
Animate the texture on the specified face/faces of the specified prim/prims by setting the texture scale and offset.  Identical to llSetTextureAnim except able to modify any prim in the link set.

llSetLinkTextureAnim( integer link, integer mode, integer face, integer sizex, integer sizey, float start, float length, float rate )

llSetLocalRot.description:
Sets the rotation of a child prim relative to the root prim

llSetLocalRot( rotation rot )

llSetMemoryLimit.description:
Request limit bytes to be reserved for this script.Returns the boolean (an integer) TRUE if the memory limit was successfully set (or FALSE if not).

integer llSetMemoryLimit( integer limit )

llSetObjectDesc.description:
Sets the prims description

llSetObjectDesc( string description )

llSetObjectName.description:
Sets the prim's name according to the name parameter.

llSetObjectName( string name )

llSetObjectPermMask.description:
Requires God Mode.Sets the given permission mask to the new value on the root object the task is attached to.

llSetObjectPermMask( integer mask, integer value )

llSetParcelMusicURL.description:
Sets the streaming audio URL for the parcel object is on

llSetParcelMusicURL( string url )

llSetPayPrice.description:
Suggest default amounts for the pay text field and pay buttons of the appearing dialog when someone chooses to pay this object.

llSetPayPrice( integer price, list quick_pay_buttons )

llSetPhysicsMaterial.description:
Used to set the physical characteristics of an object.

llSetPhysicsMaterial( integer mask, float gravity_multiplier, float restitution, float friction, float density )

llSetPos.description:
Moves the object or primitive towards pos without using physics.

llSetPos( vector pos )

llSetPrimitiveParams.description:
Sets the prim's parameters according to rules.

llSetPrimitiveParams( list rules )

llSetPrimMediaParams.description:
Set the media params for a particular face.Returns a status (an integer) that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s).

integer llSetPrimMediaParams( integer face, list params )

llSetRegionPos.description:
Tries to move the entire object so that the root prim is within 0.1m of position.Returns an integer boolean, TRUE if the object is successfully placed within 0.1 m of position, FALSE otherwise. See #Specification for details.

integer llSetRegionPos( vector position )

llSetRemoteScriptAccessPin.description:
Allows a prim to have scripts remotely loaded via llRemoteLoadScriptPin when it is passes the correct pin and the prim is set mod.

llSetRemoteScriptAccessPin( integer pin )

llSetRot.description:
Sets the rotation of the prim to rot.

llSetRot( rotation rot )

llSetScale.description:
Sets the size of the prim according to size

llSetScale( vector size )

llSetScriptState.description:
Set the running state of the script name.

llSetScriptState( string name, integer running )

llSetSitText.description:
Displays text rather than the default "Sit Here" in the right-click menu.

llSetSitText( string text )

llSetSoundQueueing.description:
Set whether attached sounds wait for the current sound to finish. If queue is TRUE, queuing is enabled, if FALSE queuing is disabled. Sound queuing is disabled by default.

llSetSoundQueueing( integer queue )

llSetSoundRadius.description:
Establishes a hard cut-off radius for audibility of scripted sounds (both attached and triggered).

llSetSoundRadius( float radius )

llSetStatus.description:
Sets the object status attributes indicated in the status mask to value

llSetStatus( integer status, integer value )

llSetText.description:
Displays text that hovers over the prim with specific color and translucency (specified with alpha).

llSetText( string text, vector color, float alpha )

llSetTexture.description:
Sets the texture of this prim's face.

llSetTexture( string texture, integer face )

llSetTextureAnim.description:
Animate the texture on the specified face/faces by setting the texture scale and offset.

llSetTextureAnim( integer mode, integer face, integer sizex, integer sizey, float start, float length, float rate )

llSetTimerEvent.description:
Cause the timer event to be triggered a maximum of once every sec seconds. Passing in 0.0 stops further timer events.

llSetTimerEvent( float sec )

llSetTorque.description:
Sets the torque of object (if the script is physical)

llSetTorque( vector torque, integer local )

llSetTouchText.description:
Displays text rather than the default "Touch" in the right-click menu

llSetTouchText( string text )

llSetVehicleFlags.description:
Enabled the specified vehicle flags

llSetVehicleFlags( integer flags )

llSetVehicleFloatParam.description:
Sets the vehicle float parameter param to value.

llSetVehicleFloatParam( integer param, float value )

llSetVehicleRotationParam.description:
Sets the vehicle rotation parameter param to rot.

llSetVehicleRotationParam( integer param, rotation rot )

llSetVehicleType.description:
Sets the vehicle type to one of the default types.

llSetVehicleType( integer type )

llSetVehicleVectorParam.description:
Sets the vehicle vector parameter param to vec.

llSetVehicleVectorParam( integer param, vector vec )

llSetVelocity.description:
Applies velocity to object

llSetVelocity( vector force, integer local )

llSHA1String.description:
Returns a string of 40 hex characters that is the SHA-1 security hash of src.

string llSHA1String( string src )

llShout.description:
Shouts the text supplied in string msg on channel supplied in integer channel.

llShout( integer channel, string msg )

llSin.description:
Returns a float that is the sine of theta.

float llSin( float theta )

llSitOnLink.description:
The avatar specified by agent_id is forced to sit on the sit target of the prim indicated by the link parameter.  If the specified link is already occupied, the simulator searches down the chain of prims in the link set looking for an available sit target.Returns an Integer

Integer llSitOnLink( key agent_id, integer link )

llSitTarget.description:
Set the sit location for the prim. The sit location is relative to the prim's position and rotation.

llSitTarget( vector offset, rotation rot )

llSleep.description:
Puts the script to sleep for sec seconds. The script will not do anything during this time.

llSleep( float sec )

llStartAnimation.description:
Start animation anim for agent that granted PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION if the permission has not been revoked.

llStartAnimation( string anim )

llStopAnimation.description:
Stop animation anim for agent that granted PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION if the permission has not been revoked.

llStopAnimation( string anim )

llStopHover.description:
Stop hovering to a height

llStopHover(  )

llStopLookAt.description:
Stop causing object to point at a target

llStopLookAt(  )

llStopSound.description:
Stops the attached sound(s) currently playing, if they were started by llLoopSound

llStopSound(  )

llStringLength.description:
Returns an integer that is the number of characters in str (not counting the null).

integer llStringLength( string str )

llStringToBase64.description:
Returns the string Base64 representation of the str interpreted as an UTF-8 byte sequence

string llStringToBase64( string str )

llStringTrim.description:
Returns a string that is src with leading and/or trailing white space (spaces, tabs, and line feeds) trimmed from it.

string llStringTrim( string src, integer type )

llSubStringIndex.description:
Returns an integer that is the index of the first instance of pattern in source.

integer llSubStringIndex( string source, string pattern )

llTakeControls.description:
Allows for intercepting of keyboard and mouse clicks, specifically those specified by controls, from the agent the script has permissions for.

llTakeControls( integer controls, integer accept, integer pass_on )

llTan.description:
Returns a float that is the tangent of theta.

float llTan( float theta )

llTarget.description:
This function is to have the script know when it has reached a position.It registers a position with a range that triggers at_target and not_at_target events continuously until unregistered.Returns a handle (an integer) to unregister the target with llTargetRemove.

integer llTarget( vector position, float range )

llTargetOmega.description:
Rotates the object/prim around axis at a rate of spinrate * llVecMag(axis) in radians per second with strength gain.

llTargetOmega( vector axis, float spinrate, float gain )

llTargetRemove.description:
Removes positional target handle registered with llTarget

llTargetRemove( integer handle )

llTeleportAgent.description:
Requests a teleport of avatar to a landmark stored in the object's inventory.  If no landmark is provided (an empty string), the avatar is teleported to the location position in the current region. In either case, the avatar is turned to face the direction given by look_at.

llTeleportAgent( key avatar, string landmark, vector position, vector look_at )

llTeleportAgentGlobalCoords.description:
Teleports an agent to set of a region_coordinates within a region at the specified global_coordinates.  The agent lands facing the direction defined by look_at.  A region's global coordinates can be retrieved using llRequestSimulatorData(region_name, DATA_SIM_POS)

llTeleportAgentGlobalCoords( key agent, vector global_coordinates, vector region_coordinates, vector look_at )

llTeleportAgentHome.description:
Teleports avatar on owner's land to their home location without any warning, similar to a God Summons or dying.

llTeleportAgentHome( key avatar )

llTextBox.description:
Shows a dialog box on avatar's screen with the text message. It contains a text box for input, any text that is entered is said by avatar on channel when the "Submit" button is clicked.

llTextBox( key avatar, string message, integer channel )

llToLower.description:
Returns a string that is src with all lower-case letters

string llToLower( string src )

llToUpper.description:
Returns a string that is src with all upper-case characters.

string llToUpper( string src )

llTransferLindenDollars.description:
Transfer amount of L$ money from script owner to destination avatar.Returns a key used in a matching transaction_result event for the success or failure of the transfer. If the transaction is successful, this key will show in the transaction history.

key llTransferLindenDollars( key destination, integer amount )

llTriggerSound.description:
Plays sound at volume, centered at but not attached to object.

llTriggerSound( string sound, float volume )

llTriggerSoundLimited.description:
Plays sound at volume, centered at but not attached to the object, limited to the box defined by vectors top_north_east and bottom_south_west

llTriggerSoundLimited( string sound, float volume, vector top_north_east, vector bottom_south_west )

llUnescapeURL.description:
Returns a string that is an unescaped/unencoded version of url, replacing "%20" with spaces etc.

string llUnescapeURL( string url )

llUnSit.description:
The agent identified by id is forced to stand up if any of the following apply:

llUnSit( key id )

llUpdateCharacter.description:
Updates settings for a character

llUpdateCharacter( list options )

llUpdateKeyValue.description:
Start an asynchronous transaction to update a key-value pair associated with the script's Experience with the given key (k) and value (v).Returns a handle (a key) that can be used to identify the corresponding dataserver event to determine if this command succeeded or failed and the results.

key llUpdateKeyValue( string k, string v, integer checked, string original_value )

llVecDist.description:
Returns a float that is the undirected nonnegative distance between vec_a and vec_b.

float llVecDist( vector vec_a, vector vec_b )

llVecMag.description:
Returns a float that is the magnitude of the vector (the undirected non-negative distance from vec to <0.0, 0.0, 0.0>).

float llVecMag( vector vec )

llVecNorm.description:
Returns the vector that is vec normalized (a unit vector sharing the same direction as vec).

vector llVecNorm( vector vec )

llVolumeDetect.description:
If detect is TRUE, VolumeDetect is enabled, physical object and avatars can pass through the object.

llVolumeDetect( integer detect )

llWanderWithin.description:
Sets a character to wander about a central spot within a specified radius.

llWanderWithin( vector origin, vector dist, list options )

llWater.description:
Returns a float that is the water height below the prim's position + offset

float llWater( vector offset )

llWhisper.description:
Whispers the text supplied in string msg on channel supplied in integer channel.

llWhisper( integer channel, string msg )

llWind.description:
Returns a vector that is the wind velocity at the prim's position + offset

vector llWind( vector offset )

llXorBase64.description:
Correctly performs an exclusive or on two Base64 strings.Returns a string that is a Base64 XOR of str1 and str2.

string llXorBase64( string str1, string str2 )

Region/x/y/z SLURL.description: SLURL to Login at / Show place profile with position
